wikipedia_page.main: George McEwin (1873 – 5 August 1945) was a lawyer and philanthropist in Adelaide, South Australia. He was a grandson of George McEwin, gardener, orchardist and maker of Glen Ewin jams.

response: *Mary Helen Butler (1908–1993) married John Neil McEwin (1907–1993) in 1931. John was the son of lawyer George McEwin (1873–1945)

He was admitted to the Bar later in 1897.Elizabeth Kwan, 'Parsons, Sir Herbert Angas (1872 - 1945)', Australian Dictionary of Biography, Volume 11, Melbourne University Press, 1988, pp. 148–150. He joined with Patrick McMahon Glynn, KC. in partnership in 1898; they were joined in October 1908 by George McEwin and subsequently by (later Sir) Mellis Napier.
George McEwin (29 January 1815 – 8 August 1885) was a gardener and orchardist in the early days of South Australia, remembered today as the founder of Glen Ewin jams and preserves.
:*George McEwin (1873 – 5 August 1945) married Evelyn Jones (1876 – 11 February 1949) on 28 April 1906.

*Robert McEwin, JP. (23 November 1847 – 20 September 1929) married Emily Longbotham (1851 – 5 November 1939) in 1872. He was chairman of George McEwin & Sons and Superintendent of Houghton Sunday School.
